827385348:
[

PMO Analyst (Governance & Reporting)

Company Name VicRoads Company Location Footscray, AU

Posted Date Posted 5 days ago Number of views 126 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

With a million more people set to call Victoria home in the next 10 years, the work of VicRoads in meeting the demands of population growth and safely connecting communities is vital to ensuring the liveability of Victoria.

'Towards Zero' serious injuries and fatalities on our roads, is a bold strategy and action plan that involves governments, communities, vehicle manufacturers, road authorities, transport companies and everyone on the road.

The Safe System Road Infrastructure Program (SSRIP) team at VicRoads works alongside the Transport Accident Commission (TAC) and other key stakeholders and is responsible for developing and delivering solutions that make a difference and enable Victoria to have the safest roads in Australia and the World!

Reporting to the Program Monitoring Office (PMO) Lead, this role supports the Leadership Team, Project Managers and stakeholders in their governance and reporting of the SSRIP Program and projects. It contributes to success through timely communication and of information, and tracking of actions and decisions.

Key Responsibilities Of The Role Are To
  • Plan, organise and facilitate various program governance meetings (eg. Program Control Committee, Steering Committee).
  • Develop, compile, transcribe and distribute agendas, minutes and papers for meetings.
  • Facilitate the regular cycle of program-level status reporting to stakeholders.
  • Provide advice, and maintain effective relationships with internal and external stakeholders.
  • Develop and implement improvements to information management processes, practices, data and systems.
What We Look For In a Successful Candidate
  • Proficient with commonly used desktop, document management, business intelligence tools & systems (eg. MS-Office, Content-Server, Power BI).
  • Strong communication and presentation skills, and ability to work with all stakeholder levels.
  • Demonstrated experience in a Portfolio/Program Management Office, or equivalent, within a large and complex organisation.
  • Initiative and eager to try new approaches.
As part of our Care, Share and Dare culture, VicRoads is committed to continually investing in our workforce and fostering an environment whereby all of our employees feel valued, engaged and empowered. To attract, retain and develop great people, we provide genuine flexibility, a culture that supports people to be their best and be themselves, and great opportunities for career development. We embrace diversity and inclusion and are proud our workforce reflects the community we serve.

For more information or a confidential discussion please contact Steve Bussey on 0419 569 050.

Key Accountabilities
KA 1.


Apply well developed planning and organisational skills to facilitate efficient and effective operation of various program governance meetings (eg. Program Control Committee, Steering Committee, Working Groups) in line with the requirements of the SSRIP Funding Deed (including Charter, Delegations, Operational Guidelines).

KA 2.


Provide sound advice and act as a role model to management and team members, concerning adoption of program/project management governance and records management processes, practices and systems.

KA 3.


Exercise professional independent judgement, and proactively follow-up approvals, issues, actions, and information requests that require attention and/or awareness.

KA 4.


Under general supervision, develop and implement innovative business improvements to complex problems, processes, practices and systems that will lead to increased business efficiency and improvements in delivery performance.

KA 5.


Contribute to the development and delivery of learning and development sessions for program/project management and team members to share knowledge and build capability.

KA 6.


Apply well developed skills to build and maintain effective relationships with internal and external stakeholders to drive the achievement of program outcomes by proactively identifying trends, emerging issues, opportunities and risk mitigations.

Key Capabilities

KC 1.


Manage meetings and develop, compile, transcribe and distribute agendas, minutes and papers for meetings.

KC 2.


Effectively manage procedures for recording, retrieving and updating information within program and project scope.

KC 3.


Provide sound advice to others on writing articulately and conveying messages clearly to target audiences.

KC 4.

Contribute to the development of and changes to a range of systems, tools and processes to foster innovation and capture new trends, ideas and technology.

KC 5.


Manage, motivate and develop staff and key stakeholders in relevant processes, systems and technology.

KC 6.


Use sound interpersonal and communication skills to develop and maintain effective networks with internal and external stakeholders to progress work.

Prerequisites
PR 1.


An appropriate tertiary qualification.

PR 2.


Proficient in commonly used program/project scheduling methods, tools & systems.

PR 3.


Demonstrated experience in a Portfolio/Program Management Office, or equivalent, within a large and complex organisation.

833613020:
[

Business Developer - Homewares/furniture

Company Name Catch.com.au Company Location Bentleigh East, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 27 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

At Catch Group we are building a next generation company with genuine 'X' factor. We are proud to be agile, disruptive, and unconventional...oh, and did we mention we also lead the way and are continuously innovating the eCommerce sector in Australia? We do that too!

Our websites include catch.com.au, brandsexclusive.com.au, thehome.com.au, mumgo.com.au, groceryrun.com.au, and pumpkinpatch.com.au; all have been built with the simple mission to offer Australians the latest and greatest products and services every single day at unbeatable prices.

Catch.com.au is now looking for a Homewares Business Developer to join it's Marketplaces team based in Bentleigh East.

The objective of the B2B Business Developer is to secure 3rd party retailers/merchants who will sell their products on the catch.com.au platform. Recruiting and launching retailers on Catch's third party marketplace, you will also analyse traffic and sales data to identify opportunities and feedback to help retailers/sellers succeed on the marketplace.

You will be able to identify, prospect and close commercial agreements. You will also be organised and have exceptional engagement skills which will enable you to operate in a fast-moving and sometimes ambiguous environment, where you will have the autonomy to take control and responsibility for achieving our business objectives.

This role provides the opportunity to be entrepreneurial, develop original ideas, and be at the forefront of eCommerce in Australia.


Responsibilities:

  • Define, execute and deliver a comprehensive supplier recruitment strategy.
  • Manage the preparation of commercial agreements and SLAs in conjunction with the legal and finance teams.
  • Support to recruit and support sellers of various types (SMEs to large retailers) to execute on aggressive growth plans.
  • Be responsible for pipelining and reporting to the executive leadership of the business


Desired Skills and Experience:

  • Experience in a sourcing/procurement/buyer related role.
  • Strong written and verbal communication
  • Demonstrated drive to set and achieve aggressive growth targets
  • Strong analytical skills (your Excel skills must be on point!).
  • A passion for delivering outstanding value to customers


We are specifically looking for those with of experience of dealing with product suppliers in the following categories:

  • Home
  • Decor
  • Furniture


With an onsite coffee shop, breakout areas, games room, free breakfasts and free WiFi our offices are geared towards those that enjoy work and life in equal measure.


If this sounds like the challenge you have been looking for we'd love to hear from you!

Quality Assurance Analyst - 12 month contract

Company Name carsales.com.au Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 2 weeks ago Number of views 286 views

Job description

  • 12-month Parental Leave contract
  • Work with the biggest and best Tech
  • Be part of a company that brings out the best in its people

Got drive? You’ll fit right in.
In 1997 we tried something new - we've been doing it ever since. From humble start-up beginnings, today we're an ASX top 100 with world-class technology and advertising solutions. Not only are we the largest online automotive, motorcycle and marine classifieds business in Australia, we're growing across Latin America and Asia.

The Role
A 12-month contract is now available for a Quality Assurance Engineer to join the Data Quality team. This position will involve working with a highly passionate, fun and talented team of engineers and stakeholders working on our Global Platform Services.

Sound good? So, here are some technical skills you will need!

  • Demonstrated experience in exploratory and automated testing including working with JavaScript and C# is a must
  • Involvement in creating test plans and progress tracking
  • Familiar with testing of REST APIs and experience with MS SQL and queries
  • Ability to share knowledge with others and the constant drive to look for the best ways of working

And some of these soft skills are also important too!

  • You’re a team player who understands that great things can only be achieved when we work together
  • You have a can-do attitude
  • You’re capable of learning on the job quickly and adapt to new challenges
  • You’re pragmatic and understand when ‘technical sacrifices’ need to be made, but don’t compromise on quality
  • You’re always willing to learn more and to share your knowledge with others
Why Apply?

carsales offers extensive opportunities to learn and evolve in a diverse, fast-paced and dynamic environment. We are committed to our people through many ongoing initiatives associated with culture and benefits, career development, health and well-being, community, work-life balance and reward, and recognition. We continually strive to attract and retain the most talented people through a number of programs designed to support learning and development. When you work at carsales you don't just have a job, but you have a rewarding career!

carsales is an equal opportunity employer who prides themselves on providing a diverse workplace that brings out the best in its people. We encourage women and men of all ages and background to apply!

And just a quick one…
Successful candidates joining the carsales family are required to undergo a National Police Record check and must have full-time Australian working rights on an ongoing basis.

824986134:
[

Java Engineer

Company Name Deloitte Australia Company Location Melbourne CBD, Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 6 days ago Number of views 278 views

Job description


At Deloitte Digital, we are all responsible for challenging the status quo, and bringing innovative and differentiated thinking to everything we do. Deloitte Digital is an innovative leader in online and mobile strategy, design and development. We work with a wide range of clients helping them adapt to and harness new media and technology. Our combination of strategic thinking and innovative solutions is what sets us apart, and we make sure to stay at the forefront of new technology.

About our team
Part Business. Part Creative. Part Technology. One hundred per cent digital. Through 22 studios spread across the globe, we provide clients with a full suite of digital services, covering digital strategy, user experience, content, creative, engineering and implementation across mobile, web and social media channels.

Our Digital Operations team is primarily responsible for the development and operations of the production systems for our client solutions. Our team is currently focused on Level Three Application Support across a number of top tier clients, with a vision to grow our DevOps capabilities.

About the role
Our Melbourne team is growing and we're on the look-out for an experienced Java Engineer to join the on-going growth of our practice.

Working closely with our Service Delivery Managers, this position is critical to the successful delivery of support solutions, continuous improvement and client management. In addition, you will be responsible for:

  • Working collaboratively within a team of engineers to ensure that support services are provided to our clients to agreed contracted service levels
  • Developing solutions, managing and maintaining high-quality Java code
  • Working directly with the clients to discuss requirements, taking ownership and resolving complex engineering tasks
  • Report on the progress of the Engineering tickets at the daily scrums
  • Develop estimates and quotes for development activity
  • Ensuring Support Governance Framework is adhered to


About your experience
You have delivered solid solutions to complex problems and can work within a team to provide consistent, high-quality solutions. To be awesome in this role you must have (mandatory experience):

  • Software Engineering or Computer Science tertiary qualifications
  • Java code development experience, ideally gained in a consulting / agency environment with tier one clients
  • Support of enterprise digital solutions such as content managed websites, customer portals or intranets
  • Self-motivated, problem-crushing attitude
  • Worked as a developer, within a team of developers
  • You're a team player and you just want to build solutions that work


Desirable experience (will be considered an advantage):

  • Adobe Experience Manager (AEM) or Web content management systems (CMS) experience
  • System engineering or system administration
  • Continuous Integration and Delivery
  • Automation tools - Ansible, Puppet, Chef
  • Amazon Web Services
  • Enterprise, web or mobile application development
  • Application or systems solution architecture
  • Linux experience


Deloitte culture
Deloitte Digital is a major force on the Australian Digital Landscape. We combine fun with serious intent where business, creativity and technology intersect.

We pride ourselves on our team of diverse, high performing Deloitte Professionals who are talented, supportive, inclusive and social - and who are at the heart of our success. Our aim is to ensure that all our people feel comfortable to bring their whole selves to work, and as a result, create a workplace that encourages the true spirit of 'And different'.

From day one at our firm you'll be considered part of the Deloitte community and our development and career progression framework will help you develop the skills and capabilities you need to succeed - in every sense of the word

If you wish to find out more please visit our careers website.

Accounts Payable Officer

Company Name Helloworld Travel Limited Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 8 hours ago Number of views 36 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Helloworld Travel Limited is one of Australia's leading integrated travel businesses, providing specialist government and corporate business travel, wholesale products, franchised retail services and ticket distribution services across 8 countries.



The Accounts Payable Department within the organisation is responsible for ensuring that all invoices are paid in a timely fashion, as per supplier agreements.



You will be responsible for:

  • Ensuring that all invoices are entered with the correct date, amount and booking reference
  • Investigating and resolving any discrepancies
  • Reconciling statements to ensure that any outstanding items are paid
  • Effectively handling supplier queries, ensuring all issues are recorded, analysed and resolved to a mutual outcome
  • Working as a team to ensure that payment runs can be completed in time for the due date of payment.


As the ideal applicant you will have:

  • The ability to maintain accuracy and attention to detail
  • An ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines
  • Excellent customer service skills to both internal and external clients
  • Our training, culture and benefits make this a great opportunity for an Accounts Payable Officer.


The role will reward you with an attractive salary and the opportunity to take your career to the next level.



To apply for this fantastic opportunity, please email your resume and covering letter by close of business Friday, 7 Septemeber 2018.


Previous applicants need not apply.

\xa0


To be eligible to apply for this position, applicants must have existing Australian work rights.\xa0 Only short listed candidates will be contacted for an interview and may be required to complete an Australian Federal Police background check.


Recruitment Agencies - thank you for thinking of us, however we do endeavour to fill our opportunities through direct channels wherever possible.

About Rubicon Water


Rubicon Water has a vision to sustainably increase global food and fibre production through improved water use efficiency. We do this by delivering advanced technology to managers of gravity fed irrigation networks, enabling them to manage their water resources with unprecedented levels of efficiency and control.

About the Role


Requires a Mechanical Design Engineer to participate in design and development projects, working on technical specifications as well as researching new parts and technologies for integration into innovative design solutions. Ability to drive change and validate concepts via calculations and FEA is essential along with the ability to work collaboratively within a team.

Duties

  • Design and development of Mechanical\xa0
  • Testing and troubleshooting of new/existing designs\xa0
  • Creation and maintenance of CAD/drawings files\xa0
  • Preparation of bill of materials and other MRP related documents;\xa0
  • Preparation of test requests/reports and design validation activities (Calculations and FEA)\xa0
  • Liaison with suppliers, manufacturing and other internal/external stakeholders to deliver projects into production;

Qualifications & Skills


  • Degree in Mechanical Engineering or related discipline.\xa0
  • Good understanding of manufacturing principles.\xa0
  • Demonstrated advanced 3D modelling and detailing abilities using Solidworks.

Culture

Rubicon Water offers an innovative and creative environment, career and professional advancement opportunities in a respectful and collaborative working environment.

Benefits
